title: Structuring Advanced Mathematical Concepts Using Digital Concept Maps

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics knowledge and basic understanding of concept connectivity
context.additional_context: Aims to systematize job-linked mathematical concepts for job seekers and adult learners. Establishes a collaborative learning environment using personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can visually represent hierarchical relationships among advanced mathematical topics (e.g., linear algebra, calculus) using digital concept mapping tools
Learners can revise concept maps based on peer feedback, demonstrating integrated understanding of complex mathematical concepts
Learners can propose mathematical approaches applicable to real job-related problems (e.g., data analysis modeling) based on concept map analysis results

resources: Digital Concept Mapping Software (e.g., CmapTools, MindMeister)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
